text: Give a man a program, frustrate him for a day. Teach a man to program, frustrate him for a lifetime.
author: Muhammad Waseem

text: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

text: That's the thing about people who think they hate computers. What they really hate is lousy programmers.
author: Larry Niven

text: A language that doesn't affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan J. Perlis

text: Everyone knows that debugging is twice as hard as writing a program in the first place. So if you're as clever as you can be when you write it, how will you ever debug it?
author: Brian Kernighan

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well.
author: Mark Twain

text: I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by.
author: Douglas Adams

text: We sit in front of a computer screen and turn some seemingly random bits of electrical charge into improvement of the human condition. Isnâ€™t that magical?
author: Eric Elliott

text: The biggest risk you can take is not taking any risk
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: Want to write fast software? Use an old computer!
author: Feross Aboukhadijeh
